bug.author: schmidtdominik
bug.summary: Streamlit fails to parse emoji shortcodes containing a dash ("-").
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Streamlit allows you to set any twitter emoji as a favicon by calling st.set_page_config(page_icon=[emoji shortcode string]) at the beginning of the script. This works well with shortcodes like ':dog:' or ':moon:' but fails with all shortcodes that contain a dash like ':crescent-moon:'. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Compare behavior of <denchmark-code>st.set_page_config(page_icon=':moon:') </denchmark-code>
with <denchmark-code>st.set_page_config(page_icon=':crescent-moon:') </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Any <denchmark-link:https://emojipedia.org/twitter/twemoji-13.0.1/>twitter emoji shortcode</denchmark-link> should be correctly displayed <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
No emoji is displayed. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.71.0 Python version: 3.7.0 OS version: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
/

comments.comment: Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/schmidtdominik>@schmidtdominik</denchmark-link> -- we're aware of this limitation and will try to get it resolved pretty soon! Thanks for filing the issue.
